title: User Authentication and Security Framework
summary: Implement secure login and multi-factor authentication for customer access.
description: Develop a secure authentication module that enables customers to log in using multi-factor authentication (MFA). This module will enforce password complexity, session management, and integration with existing identity providers to ensure compliance with banking security standards. It will include encryption for sensitive data and auditing for all authentication-related activities to ensure data protection and regulatory compliance.

title: Responsive Self-Service Portal Framework
summary: Build a responsive web portal providing seamless multi-device access.
description: Establish the core web portal infrastructure with a responsive design compatible with desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. The front-end should be built on a modular, component-based architecture ensuring consistency, scalability, and an optimized user experience. The design will adhere to accessibility standards, intuitive navigation, and branding guidelines, providing a unified interface across devices.

title: Integration Layer with Core Banking System
summary: Enable seamless communication between the portal and the core banking platform.
description: Create an integration layer through APIs and middleware services to connect the portal with the bank's core banking system. This will allow secure retrieval and submission of customer data, product details, and transaction status in real time. Implement proper error handling, data validation, and fault tolerance to maintain system consistency and reliability.

title: Personalized Customer Dashboard
summary: Display personalized banking products and account information for each user.
description: Design and implement a customer dashboard that dynamically presents products, account summaries, and services tailored to the user's profile and eligibility. Data will be fetched from integrated systems and rendered using widgets or cards to provide actionable insights and quick access links. Personalization will be driven by user attributes, activity patterns, and eligibility logic based on banking rules.

title: Account Opening and Service Request Workflows
summary: Introduce digital workflows for account opening and service requests.
description: Develop a user-friendly workflow system allowing customers to initiate and complete new account openings or service modifications online. This should involve guided steps with minimal input fields and dynamic validation rules. Users should have the ability to upload required documents, save incomplete applications, and resume them later. The workflows must comply with onboarding and KYC policies while ensuring quick processing.

title: Notifications and Real-Time Status Updates
summary: Implement real-time updates and automated email notifications for user actions.
description: Develop a notification subsystem that tracks user-initiated requests and provides real-time updates on their progress. Integrate an email notification service that automatically communicates approvals, rejections, or pending requests. Notifications should be event-driven, customizable, and compliant with privacy preferences to enhance transparency and customer engagement.

title: User Activity History and Interaction Logs
summary: Maintain complete records of all customer interactions and transactions.
description: Implement an activity logging mechanism to store all customer interactions, submissions, approvals, and communication within the portal. Users will have access to a historical view of their actions, and administrators will be able to review audit logs for compliance and troubleshooting. Data should be indexed and searchable, ensuring efficient retrieval and adherence to financial regulations.

title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
summary: Secure access privileges using role-based authorization mechanisms.
description: Develop a role-based access control system that governs user permissions within the portal. Customers will only see and access functionalities appropriate to their profile and authorization level. The system will integrate with the authentication layer and identity management solution to enforce consistent access control policies and enable scalable role management.

title: Local Database Performance and Data Synchronization
summary: Set up a dedicated database with optimized performance and sync mechanisms.
description: Implement an independent database to handle portal transactions efficiently without overloading the core banking system. This database will maintain local caches of frequently accessed data and synchronize with the core system in real time or via scheduled updates. Key focus areas will include data integrity, fault recovery, and high availability to ensure continuous and reliable performance.
